job.title: Sr Test Engineer.
job.description: Ethicon Endo Surgery Inc a member of Johnson amp Johnsons Family of Companies is currently recruiting for a Senior RampD Test Engineer located in Cincinnati OHbrbrEthicon part of the Johnson amp Johnson Medical Devices Companies has made significant contributions to surgery for more than 60 years from creating the first sutures to revolutionizing surgery with minimally invasive procedures Our continuing dedication to Shape the Future of Surgery is built on our commitment to help address the worlds most pressing health care issues and improve and save more lives Through Ethicons surgical technologies and solutions including sutures staplers energy devices trocars and hemostats and our commitment to treat serious medical conditions like obesity and cancer worldwide we deliver innovation to make a lifechanging impact For more information visit wwwethiconcombrbrOur team of engineers designers and technical specialists are in the forefront of technology in the medical device industry Working in the reliability development lab you will collaborate with medical device design engineers to provide mechanical and electromechanical testing expertise insuring timely completion of projects and providing resolution of test related issuesbrbrstrongResponsibilitiesbrstrongulliPartner with the lead design engineer or project engineers to understand product performance requirements and identify optimal test approaches and methodologiesliliManage required testing in Research and Development Lab including test execution and ensuring accuracy of results generation of test result reports and interpretation of results obtained from various studiesliliCoordinate the design development amp fabrication of new test fixtures Procure all necessary equipment to complete tests to meet program timingliliCoordinate maintenance and calibration of test equipmentliliDevelop new test procedures amp methods to ensure program reliability objectives are achievedliliTrain other associates in test equipment knowledgeliliCoordinate design amp testing by outside laboratories Evaluate amp replicate test data provided by third parties ensuring quality of data amp appropriateness of test methodsliliExecute the following phases of equipment development  equipment requirements design reviews supplier management throughout fabrication  assembly  wiring factory acceptance safety reviews troubleshooting calibrations qualifications and documentationbrbrliulstrongQualificationsbrstrongulliA minimum of a Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering is requiredliliA minimum of 4 years of experience as an engineer including 2 years in a lab and testing environment is requiredliliAbility to understand engineering design intent to conceptualize and develop test equipment and interpret the data produced is requiredliliAnalytical ability with creative thinking and problemsolving skills applied to product testing is requiredliliExperience with test fixture design is requiredliliExperience integrating and debugging test fixtures is requiredliliExperience with axial and torsional load frame testing is requiredliliExperience developing and maintaining Technical Drawing Packages for Test Equipment is requiredliliExperience creating and documenting test cases and test procedures is requiredliliExperience with CAD software SolidWorks Siemens NX is requiredliliExperience with MTS Test Suite is a strong plusliliExperience in developing maintaining and troubleshooting electromechanical systems is a strong plusliliExperience with LabView programming and Data Acquisition is a strong plusliliExperience with data acquisition hardware instrumentation and interpreting electrical schematics is a strong plusliliExperience in managing multiple parallel projects in a diverse team environment is preferredliliExperience working as a Test Engineer in a regulated environment is preferredliliTesting experience with electromechanical devices is preferredliliThis position is based on Cincinnati Ohio and may involve up to 10 travel Johnson amp Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity age national origin or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability brbrliulstrongPrimary LocationbrbrstrongUnited StatesOhioCincinnati4545 Creek RoadbrbrstrongOrganizationbrbrstrongEthicon Endo Surgery Inc 6041brbrstrongJob
